title: How to Make Chocolate Nougatines

steps.headline: Add the sugar, glucose, honey and water in a saucepan.
steps.description: Place over heat and stir occasionally. Let boil to the hard ball stage, about 248 °F (120 °C).

steps.headline: Add the salt to the eggs before beating them.
steps.description: Afterwards gradually pour in part of the syrup, beating continuously with an egg beater.

steps.headline: Heat the remainder of the syrup, leaving the syrup boiling until it is brittle when tested in cold water or use a candy thermometer testing for a temperature of 290 °F (143 °C).
Fold the syrup gradually into the beaten eggs and syrup mixture, beating constantly.
Return the mixture to the saucepan, place over heat and beat constantly until it becomes crisp when tested in cold water.
Pour into a buttered pan a little larger than an ordinary loaf tin.
Set aside and allow the mixture in the buttered pan to cool.
steps.description: Proceed to cut into pieces approximately 1 -1 1/4-in long and 3/8" wide.

steps.headline: Coat the pieces.
steps.description: Use a double boiler to melt the chocolate and coat. If required break the chocolate in smaller pieces. Let chocolate set in the refrigerator on a pan.

text: Add the sugar, glucose, honey and water in a saucepan. Place over heat and stir occasionally. Let boil to the hard ball stage, about 248 °F (120 °C). Add the salt to the eggs before beating them. Afterwards gradually pour in part of the syrup, beating continuously with an egg beater. Heat the remainder of the syrup, leaving the syrup boiling until it is brittle when tested in cold water or use a candy thermometer testing for a temperature of 290 °F (143 °C).  Fold the syrup gradually into the beaten eggs and syrup mixture, beating constantly.  Return the mixture to the saucepan, place over heat and beat constantly until it becomes crisp when tested in cold water.  Pour into a buttered pan a little larger than an ordinary loaf tin.  Set aside and allow the mixture in the buttered pan to cool. Proceed to cut into pieces approximately 1 -1 1/4-in long and 3/8" wide. Coat the pieces. Use a double boiler to melt the chocolate and coat. If required break the chocolate in smaller pieces. Let chocolate set in the refrigerator on a pan.
